critique: This is an executive order from 1940 that waives Civil Service Rules to allow Walter Kuhn to be appointed as a guard. Given the historical context, it is difficult to assess its impact on social inclusion or immigration. The order itself seems to expand executive power by circumventing standard hiring procedures. It's hard to gauge the ideological tilt without more context, but I will assume it is neutral. The order does not seem to directly impact federalism, national security, or economic regulation.
